title: The One With The Ultimate Fighting Champion

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang minus Monica is there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do you think that there’s a town in Missouri or some place called Sample? And ah, as you’re driving into town there’s-there’s like a sign, and it says “You’re in Sample.” (He says it like urine sample.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How’d it go with Pete?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Tell us!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You’re not gonna believe this. Okay, so I go over...

dialogue.speaker: BILLY CRYSTAL
dialogue.text: I’m sorry. Ex-excuse us. I’m sorry, it’s a little crowded. Do you mind if we... (motions to the couch)

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN WILLIAMS
dialogue.text: Yeah, could you scooch?

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Yeah, move over just a little bit.

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: Keep on scooching.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So guys, listen, I go over there, and umm...

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: Why? Why?! What’s wrong with me?!

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: What’s the matter?

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: I have a feelin’... I, my wife is sleeping with her gynaecologist.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: How do you know?

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: Well y'know, he’s got access.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: Y'know it’s that feeling you get, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Like when you go bowling and you know you’re in somebody else’s shoes?

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: That’s the one.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, so, so you went to Pete’s...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What happened?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Robin is speaking loudly again) I...

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: Why is this happening to me?! I don’t know, maybe it’s my wound.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Forget it. (they all turn and listen to Billy and Robin)

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: So it’s-it’s not heeled yet?

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: No-no, it’s ooozing, oozing. (to Rachel) Could you pass me the cream? Is there any—Oh, there’s the cream.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Thomas, this is gonna be hard, but I wanted it to come from me, and nobody else.

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: What is it, Tim?

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: It’s me, I’ve been sleeping with your wife.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Billy) So you’re the gynaecologist?

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Hey, I’m trying to have a private conversation! Is that okay?!

dialogue.speaker: ROBIN
dialogue.text: (starting to cry) Ooh, (to Rachel) Can I have a napkin, please? Could you please hand me a napkin? (Rachel tries to grab one, but is to slow for his tastes.) Would you--Give me this thing (grabs the napkin holder from her.) all right!! Enough! (to Billy) And you are no longer my friend! We are finished! (gets up to leave) Nada!! No more! You are a bastard for doing this!! (Billy follows him) Get away from me!!

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Thomas, come back here! (they both leave)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So Monica, what were you gonna tell us?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pause) I have no idea.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang minus Monica is there.]

events.event_description: Chandler jokes about Missouri town called Sample and its sign that says 'You're in Sample'.
Monica enters Central Perk and greets the group.
Rachel asks Monica about her date with Pete.
Monica begins to tell her story about her date with Pete.
Robin Williams and Billy Crystal ask to sit on the couch, indicating they are moving closer to the group.
Robin Williams expresses suspicion that his wife is sleeping with her gynecologist.
Billy Crystal questions Robin about his suspicion.
Robin Williams confesses to Billy Crystal that he believes he is sleeping with his wife.
Robin Williams reacts emotionally, asking for a napkin and accusing Billy of being a bastard, then leaves the scene.
Billy Crystal follows Robin Williams as they both leave the scene.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, come on, what was the big news Pete wanted to tell you Mon?! Or should I say Mrs. Monica Becker?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No-no-no oh, keep your name, don’t take his name.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He didn’t ask me to marry him.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well then definately don’t take his name.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He wanted to tell me he’s gonna compete is some ultimate fighting competition thingy.

dialogue.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogue.text: Pete?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why?! What is it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t know exactly. It’s-it’s sorta like wrestling.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (intrigued) Oh?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, but without the costumes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (disappointed) Oh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And it’s not fake, it’s totally brutal.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s two guys in a ring,

dialogue.speaker: AND THE RULES ARE
dialogue.text: “They’re are no rules.”

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So you can like, bite, and pull people’s hair and stuff?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, anything goes, except ah, eye gouging and fish hooking.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What’s fish hooking?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Huh, what’s fish hooking... (Joey sticks his finger in Ross’s mouth and pulls on his cheek, y'know like when you hook a fish.) (to Joey, sarcastic) Thanks man, that would have been really hard to describe. What is that taste?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What? My hands are totally clean, I just gave the duck a bath.

events.event_description: Rachel asks Monica about the big news Pete wanted to tell her.
Monica clarifies that Pete did not ask her to marry him.
Monica reveals Pete's intention to compete in an ultimate fighting competition.
The group reacts with surprise to Monica's revelation about Pete's fighting competition.
Monica explains that the fighting is similar to wrestling but without costumes.
Phoebe expresses disappointment about the fighting being brutal.
Chandler describes the fighting as two guys in a ring with no rules.
Monica asks if biting and pulling hair are allowed in the fight.
Ross explains that anything goes except eye gouging and fish hooking.
Ross sarcastically asks Joey what fish hooking is, leading Joey to demonstrate by pulling Ross's cheek.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing a meeting with his boss.]

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: So thanks for the warm welcome. It’s good to have you guys on my team, and I come to play. I hope you do too. Now, let’s go out there and get ‘em! Huh? And remember, there is no ‘I’ in team.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, but there’s two in martini, soo everybody back to my office.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) You! Chuckles! What’s your name?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh it’s Bing, sir. I’m sorry , I was just ah...

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: No-no, I heard what you said, funny. I like funny. (Chandler starts to leave) This team is about hard work, but it’s also about having fun. Good to have you aboard Bing! (smacks him on the butt, and Chandler leaves shocked.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing a meeting with his boss.]

events.event_description: Chandler finishes a meeting with his boss in his office.
Doug thanks the team for the warm welcome and expresses enthusiasm about joining.
Doug encourages the team to work hard and have fun, emphasizing team spirit.
Doug makes a joke about there being no 'I' in team, then instructs everyone to return to Chandler's office.
Chandler responds to Doug, making a joke about the word 'martini' and suggests everyone go back to his office.
Doug addresses Chandler directly, asking for his name and making a humorous comment about Chandler's response.
Chandler introduces himself as Bing and apologizes for his earlier response.
Doug acknowledges Chandler's humor, states the team values hard work and fun, and welcomes Chandler aboard.
Doug smacks Chandler on the butt as Chandler starts to leave the office.
Chandler leaves the office shocked after Doug's gesture.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is making reservations.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) That’s right, Ryder. Wynona Ryder for six. (listens) Thank you. (hangs up) (to the gang) Yeah, we have the reservations.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right buddy, way to go! (smacks him on the butt)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (stunned) Dude, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thank you! Today, my boss keep slapping my butt and he was acting like it was no big deal.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeesh, what’d you do about it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I didn’t do anything. I didn’t want to be the guy who has a problem with his boss slapping his bottom.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I gotta tell ya, I think it’s okay to be that guy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, maybe it’s like y'know, that jock thing. Y'know how football players pat each other after touchdowns. (pats Ross on the butt)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know I don’t, I don’t understand guys, I mean I-I would never congratulate Monica on a great stew by y'know, grabbin’ her boob.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know, for a really great stew you just y'know, stick your head in between ‘em.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, can we please go eat?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. What are we getting?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Anything but stew.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right so, Chandler, from now on, don’t give your boss a chance to get you. Y'know just ah, don’t turn your back to him.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, or you can teach him a lesson. Y'know? What you could do is you could rub something that really smells on your butt, all right? Then, when he goes to smack ya, his hand will smell. (thinking aloud) Now what could you rub on your butt that would smell bad?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross and Monica) What if Joey were president?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, hey Rach, can I ask you something?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, you can totally say no, but umm, would it be okay with you if I set Ross up on a date?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, ah with who?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, my friend, Bonnie. She just always thought Ross was really cute, and now that you two aren’t together, she asked if I could set it up, but if you’re not cool with it...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh-oh-oh, which one is Bonnie again?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You remember her from my birthday party two years ago. She’s yeah, like, average height, medium build, bald...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! (laughs) That’s fine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Great! Okay, good for you! (as they leave she slaps Rachel on the butt)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is making reservations.]

events.event_description: Ross makes a phone call to confirm reservations for six people, mentioning Wynona Ryder's name.
Ross informs the gang that the reservations have been made.
Chandler congratulates Ross and smacks him on the butt.
Ross reacts with surprise and questions Chandler's action.
Chandler explains that his boss has been slapping his butt without concern.
Monica comments that it's okay to stand up to a boss who slaps your butt.
Joey suggests that Chandler could teach his boss a lesson by rubbing something bad-smelling on his butt.
Phoebe asks Rachel for permission to set Ross up on a date with her friend Bonnie.
Rachel agrees to Phoebe's plan and describes Bonnie's appearance.
Phoebe leaves and playfully slaps Rachel on the butt as they exit.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A Gym, Pete is training for the Ultimate Fighting Championship, with his
trainer, Hoshi.]

dialogue.speaker: HOSHI
dialogue.text: You are iron. You are steel! Let me ask you something, how come when I call your computer support line, I have to wait an hour and a half?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I told you, we’re adding new operators all the time. Could we concentrate on my training?

dialogue.speaker: HOSHI
dialogue.text: It’s just hard when I know I have e-mail I can’t get !

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Monica! (runs over and kisses her) Hi honey.

dialogue.speaker: HOSHI
dialogue.text: All right, on the table. (Pete gets on the table for his rubdown)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, umm, so listen umm, my friends were telling me a little about this ah, ultimate fighting thing and it, well it sounds really dangerous. I-I don’t want you to get hurt, ‘cause I kinda like you.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh, believe me, I don’t want to get hurt either. I’m being smart about this. See these guys? They’re the best trainers in the world, and Hoshi here used to be a paid assassin. (Hoshi yells at him in Chinese) A house painter! He used to be a house painter.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Promise me you’ll be careful.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I promise.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, are we still on for tonight?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, good, ‘cause umm, well maybe we could have a little workout of our own...

dialogue.speaker: HOSHI
dialogue.text: No! No boom-boom before big fight!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How ‘bout just a boom?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: A Gym, Pete is training for the Ultimate Fighting Championship, with his
trainer, Hoshi.]

events.event_description: Hoshi encourages Pete to be strong and resilient during his training session at the gym.
Pete requests Hoshi to focus on his training instead of discussing computer support issues.
Monica enters the gym and greets Pete.
Pete kisses Monica after greeting her.
Pete gets on the table for a rubdown as instructed by Hoshi.
Monica expresses concern about the dangers of Pete's fighting training.
Pete reassures Monica that he is being careful and mentions Hoshi's background as a former assassin.
Hoshi yells at Pete in Chinese, clarifying his previous statement about being a house painter.
Monica asks Pete if they are still on for the evening.
Monica suggests they might have a workout of their own, and Hoshi forbids any intimacy before Pete's big fight.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with Bonnie, as Rachel enters.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Well that was depressing, I think I just bought a soft pretzel from one of the kids from Fame . Ready to go to the movies?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um-hmm. Oh wait! This is Bonnie. (who has hair by the way)

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: This is Bonnie? (to Phoebe) This is Bonnie? (to Bonnie) You’re Bonnie?

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: I can show you an ID if you want?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh no, I’m sorry, you look a lot different from the last time I-I saw you.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, well I just started wearing bras again.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that must be it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Bonnie) Well I hope you have fun tonight.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Thanks! You too.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) You said she was bald.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, she was bald, she’s not now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How could you not tell me that she has hair?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don’t know, I hardly ever say that about people.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looks in the window) Ohh, well, this is just perfect!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well I’m sorry, I thought you said it was okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, I said what was okay when I thought she was some weird bald chick. I mean, y'know, that girl has hair got all over head!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it won’t work out. Maybe Ross won’t like her personality.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why, does she have a bad personality?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no, Bonnie’s the best!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with Bonnie, as Rachel enters.]

events.event_description: Rachel enters Central Perk and comments on her mood and pretzel purchase to Phoebe.
Phoebe introduces Bonnie to Rachel.
Bonnie offers to show her ID to Rachel.
Rachel comments on Bonnie's appearance, noting she looks different from last time.
Bonnie mentions she has started wearing bras again.
Rachel expresses surprise and questions Phoebe about Bonnie's hair.
Rachel looks in the window and expresses frustration about Bonnie's hair.
Phoebe suggests that Bonnie's personality might affect her relationship with Ross.
Phoebe states that Bonnie is the best, implying her positive opinion of Bonnie.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler’s office, Chandler is bent over getting some water as his boss
approaches.]

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Bing! (Chandler stands bolt upright and turns around to face him.) Read your Computech proposal, a real homerun. (He goes to slap his butt, but Chandler slides over making him miss.) Ooh. Barely got ya that time, get over here. Come on. (Chandler goes over) Wham! (slaps him on the butt) Good one. That was a good one. (to a couple of Chandler’s co-workers) Keep at it team. (goes into his office)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to his co-workers) What is with him?

dialogue.speaker: PHIL
dialogue.text: With him? You’re is favourite, you’re his guy!

dialogue.speaker: STEVENS
dialogue.text: We never get smacked.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that’s not true, he-he smacked you once.

dialogue.speaker: PHIL
dialogue.text: Not on purpose, he ricocheted of you and got me.

dialogue.speaker: STEVENS
dialogue.text: I’m telling you, I need some smacks. I got a kid starting Dartmouth in the fall.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: (coming out of his office) Dartmouth? Who went to Dartmouth? Dartmouth sucks. Did you go to Dartmouth Bing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No sir.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: There you go. (smacks him on the butt)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler’s office, Chandler is bent over getting some water as his boss
approaches.]

events.event_description: Doug approaches Chandler and announces that he has read the Computech proposal, calling it a 'homerun'.
Doug attempts to slap Chandler on the butt, but Chandler slides away to avoid the slap.
Doug successfully slaps Chandler on the butt after Chandler moves closer.
Doug encourages the team to keep at it after slapping Chandler, then enters his office.
Chandler questions his co-workers about Doug's behavior.
Phil comments that Chandler is Doug's favorite and his 'guy'.
Stevens remarks that they have never been smacked by Doug.
Chandler mentions that Doug has smacked Stevens once.
Phil explains that Doug's previous smacking was accidental, ricocheting from Stevens to Phil.
Doug comes out of his office and smacks Chandler on the butt again.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Ultimate Fighting Championship, Ross and Monica are there watching Pete.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (walking up with this huge tub-o-popcorn and drink) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: God Ross, what is that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents, plus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!

dialogue.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogue.text: From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting Championship debut! He’s known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and Gentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I love you, Pete!!!

dialogue.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogue.text: And his opponent, from Hunnington Beach, California! He’s a 300 pound street fighter, Tank Abbottttttt!!!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (going up to the ring) Pete! Pete!! That guy’s pretty huge!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, Hoshi taught me how to use an opponent’s strength and weight against him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, then that guy is in serious, serious trouble.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right! You go get him! Let’s go!

dialogue.speaker: REFEREE
dialogue.text: Here we go gentlemen, here we go! (to Tank Abbott) Are you ready? (He nods, and takes out his teeth) (to Pete) Are you ready? (Pete nods, “Yes.”) Let’s get it on!!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Uh-oh.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Ultimate Fighting Championship, Ross and Monica are there watching Pete.]

events.event_description: Ross walks up holding a large tub of popcorn and a drink.
Monica questions Ross about the large tub of popcorn and drink.
Ross explains he bought the Ultimate Fighting Combo to save thirty cents and keep the cup.
Announcer introduces Pete Beck, highlighting his confrontational business style and debut in the UFC.
Monica expresses her love for Pete.
Announcer introduces Tank Abbott as Pete's opponent, describing him as a 300-pound street fighter from Huntington Beach, California.
Monica goes up to the ring to cheer for Pete, warning him about Tank Abbott's size.
Pete reassures Monica that Hoshi taught him how to use an opponent’s strength and weight against him.
Ross encourages Pete to go get Tank Abbott and cheers him on.
Referee signals the start of the fight, asks Tank Abbott if he is ready, and takes out his teeth, then asks Pete if he is ready, and signals to get it on.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Arena, after the fight. Monica is walking up to a defeated Pete.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey! (she sits down next to him) It’s me. Mon-i-ca! Can I just tell you how proud I am of you.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant “You suck!”

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now you can just look back at this thing with no regrets.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: What, look back?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, you’re not gonna get going are you?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, no. But...

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well I’m not gonna stop until I’m the Ultimate Fighting Champion.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think it just happened overnight? No. There was Moss 1, that burnt down my Dad’s garage, there was Moss 2 that would only schedule appointments in January, and 862 others that I learned from, just like I learned from this fight, never to let a guy stand on my neck.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You didn’t know that already?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Look, I’m gonna get better. Okay? I promise you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, just get a lot better. (pause) Fast.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh, one other thing. Hoshi thinks that you being ringside may have affected my concentration.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah. That-that was the problem.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Arena, after the fight. Monica is walking up to a defeated Pete.]

events.event_description: Monica approaches Pete and sits down next to him after the fight.
Monica expresses pride in Pete's performance.
Pete responds sarcastically about the crowd chanting 'You suck!'
Monica encourages Pete to reflect without regrets.
Pete questions whether he is the Ultimate Fighting Champion.
Monica clarifies that Pete is not the champion but implies he can still pursue that goal.
Pete declares his determination to become the Ultimate Fighting Champion.
Pete shares a story about creating Moss 865, illustrating his learning process from past failures.
Monica comments that Pete should get better quickly.
Pete mentions that Hoshi believes Monica's presence affected his concentration during the fight.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's balcony, Ross and Phoebe are grilling some burgers and hot
dogs.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (joining them) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey! How long until Pete’s fight?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, about five minutes. Right now they’re interviewing his opponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hot dog?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Four, please. (Ross looks at her) I’m really nervous. (Ross gives her the four dogs) Thank you. (she grabs four buns, and heads back inside)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? Oh! I gotta tell you, I-I wasn’t expecting to like her at all, I mean I actually wasn’t expecting to like anyone right now, but she’s really terrific.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ohh, that’s too bad!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I-I’m saying I liked her.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know what, there are other fish in the sea.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs, I think she’s great. Okay? We’re going out again.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (joining them) Hey! Which one’s my turkey burger?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sticking his head out the window) Hey, the fight’s starting!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, we’ll be right in. (to Chandler) So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it’s gonna be okay, because as of tomorrow I’m conducting an experiment, and if all goes as planned, my butt will be smack free.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sticking his head out the window) Fight’s over!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's balcony, Ross and Phoebe are grilling some burgers and hot
dogs.]

events.event_description: Ross and Phoebe grill burgers and hot dogs on the balcony.
Monica joins Ross and Phoebe, asking about Pete’s fight.
Monica informs Ross that Pete’s fight will start in about five minutes and mentions his opponent’s training methods.
Ross asks Monica if she wants hot dogs, and she orders four.
Monica expresses her nervousness about Pete’s fight.
Phoebe asks Ross about his feelings regarding Bonnie.
Ross shares that he unexpectedly liked Bonnie and plans to go out with her again.
Chandler joins the group and asks about his turkey burger.
Ross informs Chandler that his turkey burger is next to his foot.
Joey announces that the fight has started and then that it is over.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler’s office, Chandler is confronting his boss about the butt
smacking thing. His boss is writing on a white board.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Excuse me, Doug? (no reaction) Hey there sports fan!!

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: (turning around) Bing! You got those numbers for me?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, I ah, I didn’t do them.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Oh, you forgot?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no I just ah, didn’t do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a couple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don’t deserve any praise, verbal or otherwise.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller. (laughs) That’s okay, you’re still my number one guy! (slaps him on the butt) Bing!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Doug!!

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Hmm.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’m a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express yourself.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I gotta tell ya, if it is, you can just... kiss my ass!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no. It-it’s not about the swearing, it’s more about ah, the way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Oh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, and don’t get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It’s just that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it’s making all the other guys jealous.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Well, say no more. Y'know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing! You’re okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay. (he starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Ha! (goes to smack him on the butt, but stops, faking Chandler out) Ahhhhhhh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ahhhhh! (walks out, imitating shooting himself in the head)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler’s office, Chandler is confronting his boss about the butt
smacking thing. His boss is writing on a white board.]

events.event_description: Chandler attempts to get Doug's attention by calling out to him in his office.
Doug turns around and responds to Chandler, asking for the numbers he requested.
Chandler admits he did not complete the requested numbers and explains he was socializing and drinking instead.
Doug shares that he drank heavily the previous night and comments on his difficult drive home.
Doug praises Chandler as his 'number one guy' and playfully slaps him on the butt.
Chandler expresses discomfort with Doug's way of expressing himself, specifically regarding the butt slap.
Doug dismisses Chandler's concern, joking about the swearing and his enthusiasm for the butt slap.
Chandler clarifies that his discomfort is due to Doug's focus on his buttocks and mentions his sensitivity and jealousy among other guys.
Doug acknowledges Chandler's feelings, calls him 'okay', and indicates he will stop the behavior.
Chandler begins to leave the office after the conversation, and Doug fakes a butt slap, startling Chandler, who reacts dramatically and leaves the scene.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are talking and walking.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or inside his shower drain?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (seeing Ross and Bonnie inside Central Perk) Oh my God! Phoebe look, it’s Ross and that girl.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No! No! Look at that! (drags her away from the window) It’s a line of ants! They’re working as a team!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe! (goes back to the window)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (looking in the window) Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let’s go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them. Okay that’s, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that’s what that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh! (walking away from the window) Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he’s gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You said it was okay!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You said she was bald!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe, we can’t, we just can’t just let it happen! Okay, we have to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her head! You owe me one bald girl!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don’t get it. Aren’t you the one that decided that you didn’t want to be with Ross?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (quietly) Yes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well isn’t he your friend? Don’t you want him to be happy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I just y'know, I didn’t expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh! (sits down on the curb)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (sits down next to her and hugs her) Oh no.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, we killed them all.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are talking and walking.]

events.event_description: Rachel notices Ross and Bonnie inside Central Perk and points them out to Phoebe.
Phoebe observes Ross and Bonnie through the window and comments on ants working as a team.
Rachel urges Phoebe to look at Ross and Bonnie, insisting they are on a second date with physical contact.
Rachel accuses Phoebe of causing Ross to fall in love with Bonnie and predicts they will marry.
Rachel suggests that Phoebe should go into Central Perk and shave Bonnie's head to break them up.
Phoebe questions Rachel about her decision not to be with Ross and discusses the idea of him being happy with Bonnie.
Rachel admits she didn't expect Ross to be this happy so soon and sits down on the curb.
Phoebe sits next to Rachel, hugs her, and expresses concern that they have ruined Ross and Bonnie's relationship.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A locker room, Pete is in a full upper-body cast. Monica enters, sees him, and
gasps. Pete tries to turn around, and winces in pain.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: It’s okay, it’s not as bad as it looks, it’s a precaution. Ah, I’m not supposed to move my spine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Please tell me you’re stopping now.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I’m fine! I’d fight tonight, if they’d let me. (stands up and starts swinging his arms) See this circle I’m marking off here? This is my zone of terror.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You are insane! You-you gotta give this up!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I can’t until I’m the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I’m telling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or Superman. Now, I’m not saying I could beat Superman, but y'know, kids are stupid.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at this! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Y'know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right forearm, and a severely bruised Adam’s Apple, but that really hurt.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well then, y'know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt yourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you’re gonna have to do it without me.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well if you’re asking me to quit, then you’re asking me to be someone I’m not. I’ve got to do this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Then I’ve gotta go. Bye. (kisses him and starts to walk out)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Mon-Monica?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Could you leave a note? ‘Cause I’m on a lot of pain killers now, and I don’t know if I’ll remember this tomorrow. (She leaves.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: A locker room, Pete is in a full upper-body cast. Monica enters, sees him, and
gasps. Pete tries to turn around, and winces in pain.]

events.event_description: Pete, sitting in a full upper-body cast, attempts to turn around and winces in pain.
Monica enters the locker room, sees Pete, and gasps.
Pete tries to reassure Monica that his injury is a precaution and that he should not move his spine.
Pete stands up and swings his arms, indicating he is marking off his 'zone of terror'.
Monica pleads with Pete to stop fighting and give up his plans.
Pete insists he is fine despite his injuries and expresses his desire to become the ultimate fighter.
Pete mentions his injuries, including a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture, and a bruised Adam's Apple.
Monica tells Pete she cares about him but cannot watch him hurt himself and decides to leave.
Pete insists he must continue fighting and refuses to quit, asserting he needs to do this to be true to himself.
Monica kisses Pete goodbye and leaves the locker room, asking him to leave a note for her.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing up a meeting with his boss and the
rest of his team.]

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: So, in conclusion, the lines all go up (points to the chart), so I’m happy. Great job team! Tomorrow at 8:30. (They start to leave) Phil! Nice job. (smacks him on the butt) Stevens! Way to go! (smacks him on the butt) Joel-burg, you maniac! I love ya! (smacks him on the butt) (Chandler walks up) Bing! Good job, couldn’t have done it without ya. (he shakes his hand)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogue.speaker: STEVENS
dialogue.text: (coming back in) Oh, excuse me. I forgot my briefcase y'know, by accident.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Of course, you did. Forgot something else too ya bastard! (smacks him on the butt) (to Chandler) Well, what about you? You’re not feeling left out or anything are ya?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. No, not at all, that’s-that’s ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Everybody else got one, and you want one too. Don’t you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ye-ye-yeah, yes I do!

dialogue.speaker: DOUG
dialogue.text: Now get on out of here, you! (smacks him on the butt)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing up a meeting with his boss and the
rest of his team.]

events.event_description: Doug concludes the meeting by pointing to the chart and declaring team success.
Doug congratulates Phil and pats him on the butt.
Doug congratulates Stevens and pats him on the butt.
Doug congratulates Joel-burg and pats him on the butt.
Chandler approaches Doug and Stevens, and is acknowledged with a handshake.
Chandler responds with 'Thank you, sir.'
Stevens realizes he forgot his briefcase and mentions it.
Doug sarcastically comments on Stevens forgetting something else and pats him on the butt.
Doug questions Chandler about feeling left out.
Chandler denies feeling left out and dismisses the idea as ridiculous.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is watching Pete fight on TV. Monica is hiding in
the kitchen, not watching.]

dialogue.speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
dialogue.text: Pete Becker is circling the ring now. It looks like, he’s just trying to feel him out. Oh, Bruiser is just...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Run! Run you crazy, rich freak!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I can’t watch this. (turns her eyes away)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Check it out, he’s winning! (to Monica) Pete’s winning!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No-o-o!!

dialogue.speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
dialogue.text: Uh-oh, Bruiser has Becker on the canvas and is going for his favourite area.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh! Oh! (they all recoil in horror)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait, if that’s his favourite area, why is he being so mean to it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, this is ironic. Of your last two boyfriends, Richard didn’t want to have kids, and from the looks of it, now Pete can’t.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohh!! (they all start pointing at the screen)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is watching Pete fight on TV. Monica is hiding in
the kitchen, not watching.]

events.event_description: The TV announcer describes Pete Becker circling the ring and feeling out his opponent.
Chandler urges Pete to run, calling him a crazy, rich freak.
Rachel turns her eyes away, indicating she cannot watch the fight.
Joey exclaims that Pete is winning and tells Monica about it.
Monica reacts with surprise upon hearing Joey's statement.
The TV announcer reports that Bruiser has knocked Pete Becker to the canvas and is targeting his favorite area.
The gang recoils in horror collectively, reacting to the fight's violence.
Phoebe questions why Bruiser is being so mean to his favorite area, implying confusion about the fight.
Ross comments on the irony of Pete's situation, comparing it to his past relationship with Richard.
The gang points at the TV screen, reacting collectively to Pete's predicament.
